Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory76.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Forsaken', 3: 'An hour and forty minutes ago, signals of a huge moving horde had appeared around the residential area and the Titan Trench.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Forsaken', 3: 'They met up around the hangar passageway, but then moved another 30 kilometers in the opposite direction after they converged.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'An hour and forty minutes... It all makes sense now...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'Re-task squads to mount a rescue effort for 19-1, immediately!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'The Forsaken do not abandon our own.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Watanabe', 3: 'Ready your men!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Forsaken', 3: 'Roger!', 4: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory00.png'}
{3: 'As the battle goes on, the explosions and whizzing weapons have become a blur to Bexonidas.'}
{3: "As Bexonidas stumbles, dazed by the explosions and gunfire-induced smog, his father's story suddenly flashes into his mind with intense clarity."}
{3: 'His father said the predecessor of the two Forsaken squads, the squad that watched their "Majesties" leave, was well-known for achieving their objectives at any cost.'}
{3: 'To their enemies, they were relentless. Tactical disadvantages, severed supply lines, and lack of fire support never once slowed their advance.'}
{3: 'If they ran out ammunition, they fought with daggers. If the daggers broke, they fought with their fists. If they lost their arms—well, their teeth would work too.'}
{3: 'As long as their enemies fell before they did, it counted as a victory.'}
{3: 'All that sustained them was "Loyalty": the same loyalty burned to ash by the transport\'s departing engines.'}
{3: "However, as his father said, Watanabe's arrival made him realize that they were right to fight to the death."}
{3: "It was just that they hadn't found someone worth dying for."}
{3: 'That was what Watanabe said, according to his father, facing down their gun barrels, never flinching.'}
{3: '"After all we\'ve been through, it\'s time to remember why we became soldiers in the first place."'}
{3: '"We\'re all that\'s left of the old guard, relics with guns, abandoned by those \'above us\' when our usefulness ran its course."'}
{3: '"They hoped we would be forgotten, but I hope that we remember."'}
{3: '"Remember why we were forsaken. Remember the responsibilities we bear. Remember the people we must protect."'}
{3: '"We, the forgotten ones, the ones they left behind, are the only ones who can prove they were wrong to forget."'}
{3: '"We are the Forsaken. We remember."'}
{3: '"We bear the memories of every life, every death. Our remembrance is proof that they once existed."'}
{3: '"If you can sympathize with this, please stop this meaningless fighting and join us."'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory76.jpg'}
{3: 'Bexonidas feels something like a punch in his chest, and he falls forward, head lolling to one side.'}
{3: "—Meeting Gryphon's shattered, lifeless face."}
{2: 'Bexonidas', 3: '...I hope that... we are worth remembering, just like you said...', 4: '1'}
{3: "He must be imagining things, but he could swear he hears Watanabe's voice shouting over the short-range comms."}
{3: '...Unlikely. After all, short-range comms only have a radius of 500 meters.'}
{3: 'Either way, this is no longer an issue Bexonidas needs to think about.'}
